review: After “unplugging” from my cable provider, I did extensive research to decide which streaming device would best meet my needs and decided on the Amazon Fire TV Stick.I wanted something to stream HULU and a few other internet sites to my television without having to hook up my laptop via the HDMI cable.It was very easy to set up and the printed directions were very clear.  The video tutorial you are forced to watch and can’t get rid of is super annoying however; it would be better if it were optional as all it did was waste my time and frustrate me.Despite the fact that my N900 wireless router is a mere 19 feet away from the stick, it receives a very weak signal.  Every other device I own gets a good, much stronger signal from the basement, attic, back yard and the street in front of my house.I updated the android operating system on my Samsung Galaxy phone so that I could mirror to the stick.  The stick and my phone find each other and connect easily.  The problem is, they won’t stay connected, and as soon as I start to watch something, the stick disconnects from my phone. (one star down)I installed Miracast on my laptop, and it won’t connect to the stick.  (another star down)I picked up a Chromecast from a local retailer.  It was easier to set up, has a better connection and casted with no difficulty.You'll need to try again Amazon.
